title.native: メジャー2nd 第２シリーズ

description:
"One day, we're going to make the strongest battery ever!" Based on the promise to reunite with Hikaru again, Daigo has moved on to Fuurin Academy Middle School. Daigo is the captain for the baseball club, but with all the older students gone, the team is all girls, including Mutsuko. With a group of peculiar newcomers, the new Fuurin Academy baseball club is off to a new start!

How strong are these baseball girls?! It's the beginning of the "middle school chapter" of the endlessly passionate baseball tale!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

node.description: Mitsuda Takuya, born June 17, 1965, is a manga artist born in Fukuyama City, Hiroshima Prefecture, Japan. He has published his works primarily in Shogakukan's manga magazine, Shounen Sunday. He is best known for his long-running baseball manga Major for which he won the Shogakukan Manga Award in 1996 in the shounen category. He apprenticed under Hidenori Hara alongside Shinobu Inokuma and his former assistants include Shun Matsuena and for two days Kouji Kumeta. Mitsuda debuted in 1982, winning the Shogakukan Newcomers Award for "Banyuu". [Websunday](http://www.websunday.net/backstage/mitsuda/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B8%A1%E8%BE%BA%E6%AD%A9)

Ayumu Watanabe is a director, screenwriter, storyboard artist and a former animator.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/quarter_law) | [Profile](http://www.undecided.co.jp/profile.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E4%B8%AD%E5%B7%9D%E5%B9%B8%E5%A4%AA%E9%83%8E)

Japanese composer and arranger. He graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts' school of music. He is the son of musician and trumpet player Yoshihiro Nakagawa and older brother of the trombonist [Eijirou Nakagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/271401/Eijirou-Nakagawa). He has done music for various anime, dramas, films, and tokusatsu shows.

Nakagawa is known for collaborating with director [Gorou Taniguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98066/Gorou-Taniguchi), and has written and composed the scores for many of his projects since [s-CRY-ed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/sCRYed/) in 2001. Including the acclaimed [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Lelouch-of-the-Rebellion/) series. Outside anime, he is also noted for his work on many Super Sentai and Kamen Rider series.

**Notable works outside anime as composer:**
~!- Hyakujuu Sentai Gaoranger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2001)
- GoGo Sentai Boukenger (tokusatsu, TV series, 2006)
- Kamen Rider Decade (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider W (tokusatsu, TV series, 2009-10) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider OOO (tokusatsu, TV series, 2010) 
- Kamen Rider Wizard (tokusatsu, TV series, 2012-13)
- Kamen Rider Drive (tokusatsu, TV series, 2014) (with Shuuhei Naruse)
- Kamen Rider Revice (tokusatsu, TV series, 2021)!~

**Height:** 152 cm

[Website](https://kamishiraishimone.com/) | [Web Diary](https://ameblo.jp/mone-kamishiraishi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mone_tohoent) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mone_kamishiraishi/) 

Kamishiraishi Mone is a Japanese actress and singer managed by Toho Entertainment. Her music label is Universal Music Japan. She spent three years of her childhood in Mexico. Due to that, she became fluent in English and is able to speak basic Spanish. She is the older sister of actress [Kamishiraishi Moka](https://anilist.co/staff/130649/Kamishiraishi-Moka).

She is also known for her voice acting as Miyamizu Mitsuha in the movies "Kimi no Na wa (Your Name)" in 2016 and "Tenki no Ko (Weathering With You)" in 2019. On December 24, 2020, it was announced that she will play the main role of Yasuko in the 105th Asadora "Come Come Everybody". Kamishiraishi Mone was selected through an audition from 3061 applicants.
From February to July 2022, she played Chihiro in the stage play "Spirited Away" from Studio Ghibli.
In March and April 2023, she will play the main role of Jane Eyre in the musical “Jane Eyre” directed by John Caird.

[Website](http://amenoparade.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/amenoparade) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/amenoparade/)

Ame no Parade is a four-piece rock band from Kagoshima, Japan, formed in 2013. With Kohei Fukunaga as lead vocalist, Kosuke Yamazaki on guitar, Ryosuke Korenaga as bass, and Mineho Osawa on drums, the band is influenced by post dubstep, 80's pop, indie R & B, electro house, ambient, trap, and draws inspiration from both western genres and Japanese pop.

Ryosuke Korenaga announced his departure from the band on January 18th, 2019.

[Official Website](https://www.leo-ieirimobile.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/leoieiri_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/leoieiri/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwvWJX42p4C7IfpedYlvvGQ) 

**Leo Ieiri** is a young and talented singer, born in Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan.
